Lectric eBikes has extended its Holiday e-bike sale for an unknown amount of time longer, but will most likely continue into the new year. Many of the previous deals with up to $893 bundle savings are available, though two of the three models with price cuts have returned to their usual bundle pricing, like the XPeak 2.0 Long-Range Off-Road e-bike and a FREE $583 accessory package at $1,699 shipped. You can also find the standard XPeak 2.0 e-bike with a FREE $434 bundle at $1,499 shipped. These bundles with their e-bikes would normally run you $2,282 and $1,933 at full price, which is not only bringing back Black Friday’s same offers, but also gives you another shot at the largest bundles we’ve seen to date. MOD Bikes is continuing to offer rare savings on its e-bikes into 2026 through its newly launched New Year e-bike Sale with up to $400 discounts across its lineup. One notable low price returning this time around is on the new Groove SideCar 3 e-bike at $3,099 shipped, while its standard e-bike without the sidecar attachment is down at $1,799 shipped. This is the newest sidecar model to join the e-mobility fleet, having been released at the top of summer at $3,499. We saw it get its first discounts to the $3,099 low during Black Friday, while Christmas sales saw it down at $3,149. Now, you’re getting a second chance at the best price we have tracked, benefitting from a $400 markdown. Head below to browse the full lineup of deals while they’re still around.

items.title: Pass pool cleaning to Aiper’s Scuba S1 robot for automated swim-ready waters while at $480 (Reg. $700)
items.summary:
Through its official Amazon storefront, you can jump on the off-season savings well ahead of summer for the Aiper Scuba S1 Robotic Pool Cleaner at $479.99 shipped. Normally going for $700 in full, we saw this model spending the final week of December at this rate before rising back in price for just one day. The deal here has only been beaten out by the drops to $474 back during Black Friday and the $470 low we spotted in early-to-mid-December, with you able to save $220 off the going rate right now, giving you the third-lowest price we have tracked. While this is a versatile robot for in-ground of above-ground pools, folks with above-ground swimming holes can save a bit more by going with the Scuba SE Cordless Robotic Pool Cleaner at $139.99 shipped, which has been serving my brother well for over a year now.
